abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory, and
            project sustainability is highly likely. Overall, World Bank
            performance is satisfactory: Well-defined and well-targeted
            activities focus on project objectives, and appropriate
            support toward their completion fostered a positive
            relationship between Bank and Borrower and ultimately led to
            successful project completion. Overall Borrower performance
            is rated as highly likely for its quality inputs during
            project preparation and highly competent project
            implementation. Lessons learned include the following:
            Establishing parallel institutions may undermine
            stakeholders' support for the project. Stakeholder
            consultation and participation at the early stages of
            project preparation promotes ownership and, consequently,
            sustainability. Education Improvement Projects (PMEs) have a
            substantial impact that go betond the classroom. PME
            financial transfers should be considered grants, rather than
            sub-projects, in the legal and disbursement arrangements
            made during project preparation. A monitoring and evaluation
            system is needed to retro-feed decisionmakers with timely
            and accurate information. Management information systems
            must carefully balance appropriate technology with adequate
            training and inclusion of end-users in the design stage.
            Finally, generating demand through public campaigns is key
            to making quantum progress in enrollment.
